intro: Pachyrhizanthe aberrans, commonly known as the slender-stemmed pachyrhizanthe, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a velvety texture, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
